title: Embracing Grace
devotional:
Old Man Hemlock sat on his porch swing, the rhythmic creak a familiar comfort against the backdrop of the burgeoning spring. He watched a robin, puffed with importance, hopping across his lawn, diligently searching for worms. Hemlock chuckled, a dry, raspy sound. "Driven by instinct, that one," he muttered to himself. "Never questions the why, only the what."

Lately, Hemlock had been doing a lot of questioning. Years he'd spent as a pillar of his church, a man known for his unwavering faith and tireless service. He'd always believed in earning his place in God's good graces through deeds, through sacrifice, through… well, through a whole lot of 'whats' without ever truly understanding the 'why.' But a recent illness had slowed him down, stripped him of his ability to serve in the ways he always had. Now, confined to his porch, the 'whats' were slipping away, leaving him feeling…empty.

He confided in his grandson, a young theology student named Elias, who was visiting for the Easter break. Elias listened patiently, his brow furrowed with concern. "Grandpa," he said finally, "you've always shown me what it means to live a life of service. But maybe… maybe you've been missing the point of grace." 

Elias explained that grace wasn't something earned, but freely given. It was God's unmerited favor, a gift offered regardless of our achievements or failures. It was the 'why' that underpinned all the 'whats.' Hemlock stared out at the robin, now tugging triumphantly at a particularly stubborn worm. "So, all this time…" he began, his voice wavering. Elias gently laid a hand on his grandfather's. "All this time, God's love has been there, Grandpa. Not because of what you've done, but because of who He is."

That evening, as the sun set, painting the sky in hues of orange and purple, Hemlock sat on his porch swing, no longer feeling empty. He understood that God's grace wasn't a reward for his efforts, but the foundation upon which his life was built. It was a truth that set him free, allowing him to rest in the unshakeable knowledge that he was loved, not for what he did, but simply for who he was: a beloved child of God.
image_description: A weathered wooden porch swing on a front porch, overlooking a green lawn speckled with dandelions under a sunset.
insights: The story of Old Man Hemlock reflects the common misconception that we must earn God's favor through good deeds. However, Ephesians 2:8-9 clearly states, 'For it is by grace you have been saved, through faith—and this is not from yourselves, it is the gift of God—not by works, so that no one can boast.' This verse emphasizes that salvation and God's love are not earned but freely given as a gift, highlighting the core concept of grace in Christian theology.
prayer: Heavenly Father, I confess that I often fall into the trap of trying to earn Your love and approval. Help me to understand and embrace the gift of Your grace, knowing that it is freely given, not earned. Release me from the burden of striving and allow me to rest in Your unmerited favor. Thank you for loving me unconditionally. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: In what ways do you find yourself trying to earn God's love? How can you actively practice receiving His grace today? What does it mean to you that God's love is unconditional?
